item.title: Why does Cloudflare Pages have such a generous Free tier?
item.description: This site is hosted with Cloudflare Pages and I'm really happy with it. When I explored how to create a site like mine in 2025, I wondered why there's an abundance of good, free hosting these days. Years ago, you'd have to pay for hosting,…

item.title: Setting Up xUnit with Dependency Injection
item.description: Many developers struggle with setting up test frameworks with dependency injection (DI). This often leads to passing object instances around manually, making it harder to introduce new services to existing test fixtures.

item.title: Tracking and Personalizing Connections – Chris Woody Woodruff
item.description: In the world of socket programming, managing client sessions is where the magic happens. It’s what transforms a basic connection into a personalized, memorable experience. Whether you’re building a chat application, a multiplayer game, or a real-time dashboard, tracking and managing client sessions is the secret sauce that keeps users engaged and coming back for more.

item.title: 📚 Convert E-books into audiobooks with Kokoro
item.description: A guide on how to convert .epub e-books into high-quality audiobooks narrated by neural text-to-speech

item.title: Stop Using FluentAssertions Now
item.description:
Check out my courses on Dometrain: https://dometrain.com Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
Become a Patreon and get special perks: https://www.patreon.com/nickchapsas
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will talk about the new license change of Fluent Assertions version 8, which forces companies to pay $130 per developer per year.
Give Shoudly a star: https://github.com/shouldly/shouldly
Workshops: https://bit.ly/nickworkshops
Don't forget to comment, like and subscribe :)

Keep coding merch: https://keepcoding.shop
#csharp #dotnet
item.author: (Nick Chapsas)

item.title: If You Ever See This Speed Sign, You're Probably Going To Die - The Autopian
item.description: The Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices (MUTCD) is widely considered to be a dry and unemotional document. Published by the Department of Transportation, it outlines the basic specifications of all the street signs you could expect to see out on roads and highways across the United States. Most are familiar, but if you dive […]

item.title: Don't use cosine similarity carelessly - Piotr Migdał
item.description: Cosine similarity - the duct tape of AI. Convenient but often misused. Let's find out how to use it better.

item.title: The Simplest Way To Deploy Your Containerized .NET Applications on Azure
item.description:
Hi, I'm James Eastham In this video, you'll learn the simplest way to run modern, scalable containerized .NET applications on Azure using Azure Container Apps.
We'll cover packaging your .NET application into a container, utilizing infrastructure as code with Pulumi, and easily setting up scalable environments. Say goodbye to worrying about Kubernetes and hello to a streamlined, fully repeatable deployment process.
00:00 Setting the Scene: Building Your First Backend 00:52 Introduction to Running Containerized .NET Apps on Azure 01:17 Understanding Azure Container Apps 02:06 Configuring Azure Container Apps 04:42 Deploying with Infrastructure as Code 05:23 Defining and Running Your Application with Pulumi 11:23 Final Thoughts and Next Steps
GitHub Repo - https://github.com/jeastham1993/PlantBasedPizza/tree/microservices-module-1
item.author: (James Eastham)

item.title: Why is Git Autocorrect too fast for Formula One drivers?
item.description: Why does Git's autocorrect wait 0.1s before executing a mistyped command? Let's dig in.
